pwn.gloss: (game) the activity of doing something in an agreed succession
examples: it is my turn
it is still my play

pwn.gloss: the act of providing approval and support
examples: his vigorous backing of the conservatives got him in trouble with progressives

pwn.gloss: milk and butter and cheese
a system of timekeeping that defines the beginning and length and divisions of the year
the act of stopping something
examples: the third baseman made some remarkable stops
his stoppage of the flow resulted in a flood

pwn.gloss: an indication that makes something evident
examples: his trembling was evidence of his fear

pwn.gloss: the act of leaving (without permission) the place you are expected to be
the use of language to perform some act
the complex of all the attributes--behavioral, temperamental, emotional and mental--that characterize a unique individual
examples: their different reactions reflected their very different personalities
it is his nature to help others

pwn.gloss: knowledge accumulated by systematic study and organized by general principles
examples: mathematics is the basis for much scientific knowledge

pwn.gloss: an almost pleasurable sensation of fright
examples: a frisson of surprise shot through him

pwn.gloss: the science of matter
examples: the branch of the natural sciences dealing with the composition of substances and their properties and reactions

pwn.gloss: the act of gathering something together
the female reproductive cell
examples: the female gamete

pwn.gloss: an act of deliberate betrayal
a charge imposed and collected
implement used to brand live stock
temporary inactivity
a time of life (usually defined in years) at which some particular qualification or power arises
examples: she was now of school age
tall for his eld

pwn.gloss: materials and equipment used in teaching
the entire physical structure of an organism (an animal, plant, or human being)
examples: he felt as if his whole body were on fire

pwn.gloss: the act of decreasing or reducing something
one of the natural periods into which the year is divided by the equinoxes and solstices or atmospheric conditions
examples: the regular sequence of the seasons

pwn.gloss: a soft thin light fabric with a crinkled surface
a strong drive for success
a structure erected to commemorate persons or events
(mathematics) calculation by mathematical methods
examples: the problems at the end of the chapter demonstrated the mathematical processes involved in the derivation
they were learning the basic operations of arithmetic

pwn.gloss: space for movement
examples: room to pass
make way for
hardly enough elbow room to turn around

pwn.gloss: a verbal commitment by one person to another agreeing to do (or not to do) something in the future
a volatile flammable mixture of hydrocarbons (hexane and heptane and octane etc.) derived from petroleum
examples: used mainly as a fuel in internal-combustion engines

pwn.gloss: the bodily process of inhalation and exhalation
examples: the process of taking in oxygen from inhaled air and releasing carbon dioxide by exhalation

pwn.gloss: something that serves as a means of transportation
a violent release of energy caused by a chemical or nuclear reaction
an area of knowledge or interest
examples: his questions covered a lot of territory

pwn.gloss: a piece of land prepared for playing a game
examples: the home crowd cheered when Princeton took the field

pwn.gloss: an open fabric of string or rope or wire woven together at regular intervals
a piece of furniture with tableware for a meal laid out on it
examples: I reserved a table at my favorite restaurant

pwn.gloss: increase in price or value
examples: the news caused a general advance on the stock market

pwn.gloss: (grammar) a category of words having the same grammatical properties
baked goods made from or based on a mixture of flour, sugar, eggs, and fat
an opening (in a wall or ship or armored vehicle) for firing through
an individual instance of a type of symbol
examples: the word `error' contains three tokens of `r'

pwn.gloss: structures collectively in which people are housed
the action of accomplishing something
the quality of being difficult
examples: they agreed about the difficulty of the climb

pwn.gloss: one of two divisions into which some games or performances are divided: the two divisions are separated by an interval
a group's refusal to work in protest against low pay or bad work conditions
examples: the strike lasted more than a month before it was settled

pwn.gloss: being inactive
examples: being less active

pwn.gloss: an informal term for a person's role
examples: he took off his politician's hat and talked frankly

pwn.gloss: a silvery malleable metallic element that resists corrosion
examples: used in many alloys and to coat other metals to prevent corrosion
obtained chiefly from cassiterite where it occurs as tin oxide

pwn.gloss: the act of nodding the head
the contestant you hope to defeat
examples: he had respect for his rivals
he wanted to know what the competition was doing

pwn.gloss: the waging of armed conflict against an enemy
examples: thousands of people were killed in the war

pwn.gloss: an object firmly fixed in place (especially in a household)
a collection of things (goods or works of art etc.) for public display
the properties that distinguish organisms on the basis of their reproductive roles
examples: she didn't want to know the sex of the foetus

pwn.gloss: coins collectively
an event that occurs when something passes from one state or phase to another
examples: the change was intended to increase sales
this storm is certainly a change for the worse
the neighborhood had undergone few modifications since his last visit years ago

pwn.gloss: adhering to moral principles
the state of being certain that adverse effects will not be caused by some agent under defined conditions
examples: insure the safety of the children
the reciprocal of safety is risk

pwn.gloss: the post or function properly or customarily occupied or served by another
examples: can you go in my stead?
took his place
in lieu of

pwn.gloss: an institution (public or private) that collects funds (from the public or other institutions) and invests them in financial assets
edible seeds or roots or stems or leaves or bulbs or tubers or nonsweet fruits of any of numerous herbaceous plant
the outcome of an event especially as relative to an individual
prevents access or progress
a particular manner of connectedness
examples: the relatedness of all living things

pwn.gloss: the space between two lines or planes that intersect
examples: the inclination of one line to another
measured in degrees or radians

pwn.gloss: a piece of meat that has been cut from an animal carcass
a person who exercises authority over civilian affairs
land that is covered with trees and shrubs
an attainment that is successful
examples: his success in the marathon was unexpected
his new play was a great success

pwn.gloss: a musical instrument in which the sound is produced by one object striking another
artifact made by weaving or felting or knitting or crocheting natural or synthetic fibers
examples: the fabric in the curtains was light and semitransparent

pwn.gloss: a structure used to defend against attack
examples: the artillery battered down the defenses

pwn.gloss: one of the natural units into which linguistic messages can be analyzed
the speech act of disagreeing or arguing or disputing
an abstract idea of that which is due to a person or governmental body by law or tradition or nature
examples: they are endowed by their Creator with certain unalienable Rights
Certain rights can never be granted to the government but must be kept in the hands of the people"- Eleanor Roosevelt
a right is not something that somebody gives you
it is something that nobody can take away

pwn.gloss: the time of life when sex glands become functional
a distinct feature or element in a problem
examples: he studied every facet of the question

pwn.gloss: natural objects visible in the sky
something that is lost
examples: the car was a total loss
loss of livestock left the rancher bankrupt

pwn.gloss: any of the terminal members of the hand (sometimes excepting the thumb)
examples: her fingers were long and thin

pwn.gloss: the act of building up an accumulation
examples: I envied his rapid buildup of assets
a military buildup in preparation for the invasion

pwn.gloss: the sound of a drum (especially a snare drum) beaten rapidly and continuously
a substance that unites or bonds surfaces together
the yield from plants in a single growing season
a body of people or families living together and sharing everything
the act of contaminating or polluting
examples: including (either intentionally or accidentally) unwanted substances or factors

pwn.gloss: the state of having little or no money and few or no material possessions
money or goods or services owed by one person to another
an immediate objective
examples: gossip was the main business of the evening

pwn.gloss: the event consisting of the start of something
examples: the beginning of the war

pwn.gloss: a building or place that provides a particular service or is used for a particular industry
examples: the assembly plant is an enormous facility

pwn.gloss: the act of escaping physically
examples: he made his escape from the mental hospital
the canary escaped from its cage
his flight was an indication of his guilt

pwn.gloss: the 3rd planet from the sun
examples: the planet we live on
the Earth moves around the sun
he sailed around the world

pwn.gloss: an architectural partition with a height and length greater than its thickness
examples: used to divide or enclose an area or to support another structure
the south wall had a small window
the walls were covered with pictures

pwn.gloss: outward or visible aspect of a person or thing
